channel.title: Water is invisible ontop
channel.description:
Hi I am trying to make a pool, I use block tool, make area for water, use nodraw, choose water and still don't see it. When I just in water I do see it, I put water lod control too.?? Any ideas?
ty

item.title: Water is invisible ontop
item.dc:creator: _I-M_Taz
item.description:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/9y9pab23l1b4v7m/cs_minti_skybox.7z?dl=0 the water is fixed , when you choose a water texture pick one of the blueish colour ones not the off white , other problems with the map are scaling door sizes are to small , some brushes don’t align correctly and have small gaps, there was one in the sky box but tats fixed now you also need to add a light_enviroment entity, you did have a sky_camerma in the main level but thats fixed, the map will now compile in around 5mins but you will need to optimise it after doing further work the link is the fixed vmf with a compilied bsp

item.title: Water is invisible ontop
item.dc:creator: Crypt

lol Daaamn, VIS shouldn’t take more than a literal second or two, if even that, even on large or complex maps. Gotta get that geometry and optimization under control, yo.

Read full topic

item.title: Water is invisible ontop
item.dc:creator: LordDz
item.description:
It’s 1/16 actually, so scale everything by 0.0625.
But don’t bother with the 3d skybox until you’ve got the basic mappings in good shape.

What I meant with xy is this:

  1. Open your map, press Shift + S (Selection Tool), Drag a selection circle over your whole map in the top view:

    1800×1022

  2. Press Enter, press Shift + A (Texture tool)

  3. Reset the texture settings, press apply. You now no longer have any stretched textures that look awful.

The map in the pictures takes about 11 seconds for the vvis and 50 seconds for the lighting. So that’s why optimization of your map is so important.

Read full topic

item.title: Water is invisible ontop
item.dc:creator: LordDz
item.description:
Alright, some constructive critisism coming up!

Use lowercase for map names, all other maps do, so should yours.

I went ahead and decompiled the map as I don’t have CSS installed.

You have a lot of stuff you could func_detail, would make the map compile faster for ya. (Like, always func_detail stairs)
Some clipping errors here and there.

The bottom carpet floor has a texture scale of 2. The normal texture scale is 0.25, see my reply about the texture lock and fix that.
Easiest way to fix this would be to select your whole map, select the texture tool and set texture scale to 0.25 on XY and apply.

func_buyzones doesn’t have to be hollow, just create a block with the TRIGGER texture and make it into a func_buyzone.

You’re improving, but still have some things to fix.

Read full topic

item.title: Water is invisible ontop
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
relvistcb:

if I want to make a 3d skybox, how to I highlight my whole map and drag it over off to sde?

Just drag a huge selection box over everything that you care about, in a 2D view, and hit enter. It’s the same as selecting anything else.

Read full topic

item.title: Water is invisible ontop
item.dc:creator: LordDz
item.description:
Read the post above yours, you need to optimise your map. A good general rule is to func_detail while making the geometry, or it’s going to be a pain once the map starts getting larger.
So all of those small green rocks you’ve made, func_detail them, the stairs, func_detail, the ceiling, etc. Ah you get the idea.

  • Map on a grid of size 16 and set it to lower when you need to do detailed work, then set it back again. Your map is on a grid of 1. BAD!

I see why your water isn’t working now, you’ve made it into a func_water_analog. Don’t.
Instead, make a brush with the NODRAW texture, then select a water texture (not the moving ones, they look shite!), select the texture tool and right click on top of the water.
Interlopers water tutorial

Your map is good looking for a wip, but you need to get the optimization going or you’re going to have a hell working with it.
I recommend ya look at how valve made their maps, go to visgroups and hide func_detail, you’ll see how much of the map that disappears.

Read full topic

item.title: Water is invisible ontop
item.dc:creator: LordDz
item.description:
Alright, post the .vmf

Source does generate invisible rectangular boxes of your map, these are called ‘areaportals’. To make it easier for source to generate these boxes, we can func_detail complex geometry (round stuff, roofs, windows, anything small).
However, leave floors, walls and ceilings as regular brushes, these work as your “walls” for the boxes, without them your level is going to start to lag.

To make func_details is easy, just select one or more brushes and press CTRL + T.

For more help, check this out:
https://www.optimization.interlopers.net/index.php?chapter=func_detail

Read full topic
